Name: Balyala Kweyamba Group
description:
The group is located in rural area called Lwabanda and is comprised of eight members, both men and women. They are involved in different activities which include farming, trade, local brewing, among others.

Crowther is a married man, aged 45, with four children, three of whom attend school and live with the family in Lwabanda. Crowther does farming and also does trading as a side business. He started his business in 1996 and works all seven days of the week, 12 hours per day. He started the business because it was more profitable and is acquiring this loan to buy stock of organic fertilizers to help boost his yields and income.

His clients are residents from urban areas and those from nearby villages and his hope for the future is to educate his children and also buy more land for farming. His challenge is limited capital and he describes himself as an honest and hardworking man. He encourages lenders to give clients the loan amount in order to enable them meet their targets.
